name: Java Best Practices
description: A concise standard for consistent Java code covering naming, structure, exceptions, immutability, collections, testing, documentation, and common object-oriented patterns.

rules.content: Name classes and interfaces in PascalCase nouns, using singular form for types representing a single entity.
Use lowerCamelCase for methods and variables, starting with a verb for methods and a noun for fields.
Declare method parameters and local variables as final when they are not reassigned.
Use checked exceptions for recoverable conditions and unchecked exceptions for programming errors.
Prefer interfaces over concrete classes for method parameters, fields, and return types when depending on behavior.
Use constructors or static factory methods instead of public setters for required immutable state.
Use generics for collections and APIs instead of raw types.
Use try-with-resources for Closeable or AutoCloseable resources instead of manual finally blocks.
Annotate public classes and public methods with Javadoc describing purpose, parameters, return values, and thrown exceptions.
Structure unit tests using Arrange-Act-Assert with descriptive method names and one logical assertion group per test.
